notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: ATTENTION: Local access and user-level privileges are required to exploit these vulnerabilities
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: NCCIC/ICS-CERT recommends that users take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: ICS-CERT also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the ICS -CERT Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT web site.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to ICS-CERT for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: No known public exploits specifically target these vulnerabilities. These vulnerabilities are not remotely exploitable.
notes.title: Exploitability

notes.text: Local, non-administrative users may be able to replace or modify original application files with malicious ones.CVE-2017-12699 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.1 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: According to AzeoTech, the newest version (Version 17.1) gives write privileges only to administrators and no longer searches for dlls outside of the application directory.
AzeoTech provides the following instructions to upgrade to Version 17.1. Existing users can download and install the DAQFactory trial
The user's license is maintained. Because this is the standard update path for DAQFactory, most users will be familiar with the process.

notes.text: An uncontrolled search path element vulnerability has been identified, which may execute malicious DLL files that have been placed within the search path.CVE-2017-5147 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 4.2 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:L/AC:H/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:L/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: According to AzeoTech, the newest version (Version 17.1) gives write privileges only to administrators and no longer searches for dlls outside of the application directory.
AzeoTech provides the following instructions to upgrade to Version 17.1. Existing users can download and install the DAQFactory trial
The user's license is maintained. Because this is the standard update path for DAQFactory, most users will be familiar with the process.
